text: A special seven Nightly News Morgan Poll taken across the country points to a victory for the Coalition
The death of an Independent candidate has delayed voting for the House for a month
This morning because we've got to turn out twice but uum the whole election could just figure on this one area, you know
The Prime Minister was taking heart from election eve opinion polls, showing Labor closing the gap on the Coalition
The jobs are going to take a while to come but at least the growth's back and the economy's turned the corner
Some last minute autographs
Bigger one bigger come on yeah that's it
Dr Hewson said he campaigned well, now it's in the hands of the people
We've given it our best shot

Dr Hewson will win and um for that reason what I'm saying to people is that it's very very important that Democrats are in there to um not only keep the bastards honest but to keep the bastards fair and just and equitable as well
The man in the hat who would be Deputy Prime Minister if the Coalition wins tonight was voting in the New South Wales border town of Albury
I'm quietly confident people are voting for change um for jobs, and for an end of the ten years hard Labor
Pollster Gary Morgan surveyed voters today across the Nation
The poll shows that the Liberal National Party's gunna  win the Election
Dennis Grant, Seven Nightly News
It's an enormous task but with state of the art technology the first results are already coming in
Until just ten days ago it had been part of the Canberra Showgrounds
Um, it's a fair task
The last results will come two hours later from Western Australia
Otherwise we'll have something later tonight
In Canberra Helen McCabe, Seven Nightly News
Labor holds a strong majority of the State's fifty Seats, but both major parties expect shocks in tonight's count
Labor currently holds thirty of the State's fifty Seats, the Liberals have twelve, the National Party eight
Independent Ted Macks says in a hung parliament he would support the party with most members
But I really do believe that we're going to win back the Seat
How late did you make up your mind
About on the steps here
Jim Meare, Seven Nightly News
Good evening
Good evening to you
Colin, what do you make of those early results
Ah In Franklin and Lyons they're lying very well at the moment
Ah that indicates, what do they indicate at this early stage
I certainly wouldn't say that they determine that the result is definitely the Coalition's
Joe Farrugia was making a come back when his car crashed in the feature race at Parramatta Speedway
Then just before ten o'clock last night, the most tragic of ironies
Went through very quickly
Farrugia will be remembered as a popular and respected veteran of speed car racing
Joe was ah regarded as just a good bloke and ah this tragedy um he'll be missed obviously by his family, but he'll missed by everyone in motor sport
Adam Walters, Seven Nightly News
The man hunt for the two men and a woman prison officer ended this afternoon near Lake Eildon north of Melbourne
An officer was injured, a volley of shots had been fired
As a result of that, one Police member received minor wounds, minor wound and um a male and female were taken into custody and a third person, a male, is deceased
Emma Rossi, Seven Nightly News
He's now being interrogated
News of his release brought relief to his grandfather in Melbourne
Really happy that he's out
Federal agents refused a request from her lawyer to go inside the compound
